JLutils
  • Reference

International formatter

Use a dot as decimal separator and a space as separator for thousands.

int(x, digits = 1)

int0(x)

int1(x)

int2(x)

int3(x)

int4(x)

int5(x)

Arguments

x

a numeric vector to format
digits

number of decimal digits to display

Details

int0(x) is a shortcut for int(x, digits = 0), int1(x) for int(x, digits = 1), etc.

Examples

int(12345.67)
#> [1] "12 345.7"
int0(c(0.123, 123.4567, 1234567.89))
#> [1] "        0" "      123" "1 234 568"
int2(c(0.123, 123.4567, 1234567.89))
#> [1] "        0.12" "      123.46" "1 234 567.89"
int5(c(0.123, 123.4567, 1234567.89))
#> [1] "        0.12300" "      123.45670" "1 234 567.89000"

Contents

  • Details
